document.docTitle: Billibathynella wolframnoodti Hong & Cho 2009, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of Billibathynella from Western Australia (Crustacea, Syncarida, Parabathynellidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of Billibathynella from Western Australia (Crustacea, Syncarida, Parabathynellidae)

caption.paragraph:
Figure 1.
Billibathynella wolframnoodti
sp. nov. (male: holotype). (A) General habitus (lateral); (B) left antennule (lateral); (C) left antenna (dorsal); (D) labrum (ventral); (E) right mandible (dorsal); (F) molar process of right mandible (lateral); (G) right maxillule (dorsal); (H) right maxilla (dorsal). Scale bars 0.1 mm, unless specified.

materialsCitation.collectorName: W. F. Humphreys & J. M. Waldock

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype .

, ( W.F. Humphreys and J.M. Waldock ) ( WAM C 40057 ).

caption.paragraph:
Figure 2.
Billibathynella wolframnoodti
sp. nov. (male: holotype, female: allotype). (A) Left and right thoracopod VIII, male (frontal); (B) left and right thoracopod VIII, male (ventral); (C) exopod of right thoracopods VIII, male (ventral); (D) left and right thoracopod VIII, female (ventral); (E) pleotelson and furcal rami, male (dorsal); (F) uropod, pleotelson and furcal rami, male (lateral); (G) right uropod, male (dorsal); (H) distal part of left furcal ramus, male (dorsal); (I) distal part of right uropodal endopod, male (lateral). Scale bars 0.1 mm, unless specified.

Figure 3.
Billibathynella wolframnoodti
sp. nov. (male: holotype). (A) Right thoracopod I (frontal); (B) right thoracopod II (frontal); (C) right thoracopod III (frontal). Scale bar 0.1 mm.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Allotype .
Female, dissected on two slides, same data as of holotype ( WAM C 40058 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes .
Two males, each kept as a whole specimen on a slide ( WAM C 40059 â€“ C 40060 )
.
Body ( Figure 1A ). Elongated and cylindrical, length 5.12 mm (other males: 4.64, 4.56), approximately 10 times as long as wide. Head as long as anterior three thoracic segments combined.

Antennule ( Figure 1B ). Seven-segmented. First segment with one seta on inner distal margin, three simple dorsal setae, and one dorsal, one ventromedial and two lateral plumose setae. Second segment with one group of four plumose setae and eight simple setae on inner margin. Third segment with three lateral setae including one plumose seta and eleven setae on inner margin. Inner flagellum of third segment with three simple setae. Fourth segment with one stub seta and one plumose seta on dorsal margin, and two stub setae and two plumose setae on outer distal apophysis. Fifth segment with one dorsal seta and six setae on inner margin. Sixth segment with one aesthetasc, one seta, and two aesthetascs dorsally, and with five setae on inner margin. Seventh segment with three aesthetascs and four simple setae.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 4.
Billibathynella wolframnoodti
sp. nov. (male: holotype). (A) Right thoracopod IV (frontal); (B) right thoracopod V (frontal); (C) pleopod I (ventral). Scale bars 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Antenna ( Figure 1C ). Seven-segmented, as long as the length of antennular segments 1â€“4. Setal formula: 0+0/0+0/1+1/2+1/0+0/3+2/4(1).

caption.paragraph:
Figure 5.
Billibathynella wolframnoodti
sp. nov. (male: holotype). (A) Right thoracopod VI (frontal); (B) right thoracopod VII (frontal). Scale bar 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Labrum ( Figure 1D ). Flat with 12 teeth of similar size flanked by five teeth decreasing in size laterally on both lateral sides. Inner surface with numerous rows of ctenidia and a few nipple-like protrusions.
Mandible ( Figure 1E,F ). With incisor process of six teeth. Tooth of ventral edge triangular. Spine row consisting of 14 spines. Palp of one segment, with one apical seta.
Maxillule ( Figure 1G ). Two-segmented. Proximal segment with four setae on inner distal margin. Distal segment with two terminal spines, one large most distal spine
and six spines on inner edge, and three simple setae on outer distal margin. The most distal spine of distal segment slightly longer than the other spines.

Thoracopods. Thoracopods Iâ€“IV ( Figures 3Aâ€“C , 4A ) increasing in size posteriorly. Thoracopods IVâ€“VII ( Figures 4A,B , 5A,B ) similar in size. Thoracopods Iâ€“VII each bearing one small epipod on protopod and one seta on basipod. Number of segments of exopods of thoracopods Iâ€“VII: 8-11-12-12-12-13-12. All the thoracopods with two setae in each segment of the exopod, except on the first segment where they have three or four setae. Endopod of thoracopods Iâ€“VII four-segmented, setal formulae given in Table 1 . Thoracopod VIII ( Figure 2A,B ) more or less rectangular in frontal view, twice as long as wide. Protopod massive, with prominent penial region with a distal opening. Epipod large, triangular, its distal part reaching the penial region of the protopod. Basipod without setae, inner margin of basipod drawn out into projection. Exopod ( Figure 2C ) one-third size of basipod, triangular, dentate distally, bearing three subterminal setae. Endopod half as large as exopod, with two distal setae.
First pleopod ( Figure 4C ). In form of two stubs being distanced from each other basally. Each stub bearing two distal setae of different size.
Pleotelson ( Figure 2E,F ). With one seta near the base of furcal rami on both sides. Anal operculum concave.
Furcal rami ( Figure 2E,F,H ). Four times as long as width, almost as long as pleotelson, with two large distal spines and 19 thin spines on inner margin, and two dorsal plumose setae.

caption.paragraph:
Table 1. Setal formulae for thoracopodal endopods of
Billibathynella wolframnoodti
sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: The female differs from the male as follows. Body length 4.36 mm . Setal formula of antenna: 0+0/0+0/1+1/2+1/0+0/2+2/4(1). Setal formula of maxilla: 5-7-17-15. Number of exopodal segments of thoracopods Iâ€“VII: 7-9-11-11-11-11-11. Setal formula of thoracopodal endopods is shown in Table 1 . Both right and left thoracopods VIII ( Figure 2D ) cone-shaped, half as large as endopod of male thoracopod VIII. Uropodal sympod with 22 spines.

In two male paratypes the following variations are observed. The sixth antennal segment with four setae; the second segment of maxilla with seven setae; number of exopodal segments of thoracopods Iâ€“VII: 6-9-10-11-11-11-10. Setal formula of thoracopodal endopods is shown in Table 1 . The uropod sympod with 22 to 23 spines; endopod with six spines on inner margin; exopod with 17 to 18 setae on outer and terminal margin.
